result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Robert Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Robert Roth is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Robert Roth was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Jason Robert Roth was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3 and 4.
Counts 2 and 5 concurrent.
Defendant to report to Probation by Monday March 16, 2015 by end of day.
Bond continues until March 16, 2015.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: No Contact whatsoever with John McCuthin.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Consecutive with Dunn County Jail.
Defendant to serve 7 days and balance of 23 days can be used by Probation Agent for violations.
Defendant can serve in Dunn County Jail if at no cost to St. Croix County.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 5 concurrent but consecutive to Dunn County Sentence.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Francis Xavier Rivard, DF: Jason Robert Roth appeared.  Court called.  Attorney Rivard recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 2 & Ct. 5.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct. 2 & Ct. 5. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, Ct 3 & Ct 4. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 2 in 14CF504 is concurrent to Ct. 5 except for costs
- S/W 1 year probation with conditions
-  AODA with follow through
- 30 days in the St. Croix County Jail consecutive with Dunn County Jail leaving the DE to serve 7 days.  Balance of the 23 days can be used by the probation officer for violations
- DE can serve time in Dunn County at no cost to St. Croix County 
-  Court costs of $486 for the two counts
-  Restitution in Ct. 5 to be paid to St. Croix County for $361.00  Apply money on file
-  It is hereby ordered, in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, John McCutchin.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Bail is continued through Monday 03/16/2015 and DE must report to probation by the end of the day on 03/16/15
- 20 days to appeal
filed by ADA Kenneth Sortedahl. eif

RE: ARGN - Court reads charge and maximum penalties. Defendant pleads not guilty. A speedy trial is not demanded. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

and   _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $5000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, John M. or his residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Jason Robert Roth appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Defendant is eligible for PD.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Prelim demanded. ADA Sortedahl requests $1000.00 cash bond, Atty Caton argues. Speedy prelim waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
